item.name: Abetto
item.comment: Unnecessarily slow and uncomfortable game mechanics.

item.name: The Adventurers: The Pyramid of Horus
Alle meine Entchen
item.comment: I usually hate to play kids games, but this one not as much. I rate it both as a kid who wants to play, as a parent who wants to be involved and as a designer to appreciate the design.

item.name: Alles KÃ¤se!
item.comment: Kind of boring to me, but I guess it would be fun for the kids. I will probably not play it again, but I can appreciate the design - so it's rated as such.

item.name: Android: Netrunner
item.comment: Addicted to it.

item.name: Android: Netrunner â A Study in Static
Android: Netrunner â Creation and Control
Android: Netrunner â Fear and Loathing
Android: Netrunner â Honor and Profit
Android: Netrunner â The Spaces Between
Android: Netrunner â Up and Over
Android: Netrunner â What Lies Ahead
Augustus
item.comment: Lotto!

item.name: Ballons
item.comment: No decision making, no dexterity.. where is the game? I would not play it ever, but I doubt anyone expected that I would. I can only appreciate the design for a kids game - so it's rated as such.

item.name: Betrayal at House on the Hill
Cash or Crash
item.comment: Not sure if I disliked it as much because I lost first. Probably. Games that cut out a player without a good reason have a flawed design.

item.name: Cubulus
item.comment: I can appreciate the effort for expanding tic-tac-toe, but I don't think you should have bothered. It's still boring as hell.

item.name: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game
Dixit
item.comment: Not really my thing. I prefer more strategic and competitive games, but I can appreciate the charm.

item.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
item.comment: Intense.

item.name: Five Crowns
item.comment: Too random and unnecessarily prolonged.

item.name: Food Chain
item.comment: Seemed too rng, but maybe I was just unlucky enough to start off with 8x berries. Would like to play some more to actually see how it plays.

item.name: A Game of Thrones: The Board Game (Second Edition)
A Game of Thrones: The Card Game
A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition)
Game of Trains
item.comment: Nice filler. It might seem too random on first glance, but it really is not. I am still yet to find the best tactic - looking forward to it.

item.name: Klack!
item.comment: I enjoy only a few dexterity games - this is not one of those.

item.name: Legendary Encounters: A Predator Deck Building Game
Legendary Encounters: An Alien Deck Building Game
Libertalia
item.comment: This could be one of the rare board games that I actually buy myself.

item.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring Deck-Building Game
Lost Legacy: Second Chronicle â Vorpal Sword & Whitegold Spire
Love Letter
item.comment: Self-made edition.

item.name: Martian Dice
item.comment: I think there are better fillers.

item.name: Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men
Monopoly: The Simpsons Electronic Banking Edition
item.comment: I do prefer to use real money over the electronic cards. Real money had more faster and efficient game-play.
item.conditiontext: Not that interested in a trade, but I'll check any offer.

item.name: Nature of the Beast: City vs. Suburb
Nizam
item.comment: I could give it another go, but it seemed pretty boring.

item.name: Pandemic
item.comment: The re-playability for me is an issue. If I don't want to play it anymore it means I don't really like it anymore.

item.name: Potion-Making: Practice
item.comment: Too random for seeming tactical possibilities.

item.name: Pylos
item.comment: Not as interesting as other similar type games.

item.name: Qin
item.comment: At first I was really impressed. Now, not so much. But it is still a decent game.

item.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
Saboteur
item.comment: Good enough, but the 2nd part is better!

item.name: Saboteur 2 (expansion-only editions)
item.comment: My group really loves it!

item.name: Scrabble
item.comment: Not really my thing.. I prefer numbers over letters in my games :)

item.name: Shokoba
item.comment: Nice filler.

item.name: Sly Dice
item.comment: My kind of mind-game.

item.name: Sultans of Karaya
item.comment: A nice improvement for a somewhat lame version of the game that we are playing in our group, rarely. I will get me a localized version of this game when it comes out. Mos def!

item.name: Tales & Games: The Three Little Pigs
Tsuro
item.comment: I somehow thought that the game-play would be more fun or interesting.

item.name: VoilÃ !
item.comment: I don't really like dexterity games, but here there is a limited interaction between players so it does not get that messy. I will enjoy this on a specific occasion.

item.name: We Will Wok You
item.comment: Decent enough. Would like to play some more.

item.name: Zombie! Run for Your Lives!
item.comment: Quite boring and scripted. No actual decision making or anything.

item.name: Zombies!!!
item.comment: Looks like I will have to tinker the rules or this game takes us 3-6h to play out.

item.name: Zoon
item.comment: It seemed too random for what appears could be slightly more strategic game. Also the game play was not as cool as I expected.

item.name: Zusammen mit den Kleinen BÃ¤ren zÃ¤hlen lernen
item.comment: A very simple counting game for kids. I would not play it ever, but I can appreciate the design - so it's rated as such.
